intro: Laelia schroederae, commonly known as the Schröder's orchid, is a species native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. It is a terrestrial orchid that thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. The plant produces striking, long-lasting flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, often with intricate patterns. It is characterized by its sympodial growth habit and fleshy roots adapted to its harsh, mountainous habitat. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is highly valued in horticulture and conservation efforts.
